CrazyChess.logic

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • CrazyChess.logic.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with some utilities for getting pieces from and placing pieces to game states
    Author:
    Darius

                              int y,
                              boolean isDebug,
                              AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Retrieves piece at coordinate location
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        isDebug - isDebug mode activated
        gamestate - current game state
        Returns:
        piece the Piece at (x,y), null if invalid

      • getPiece

        public AbstractPiece getPiece(Position pos,
                              boolean isDebug,
                              AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Retrieves piece at Position class location
        Parameters:
        pos - the position object to retrieve located piece
        isDebug - isDebug mode activated
        gamestate - current game state
        Returns:
        the Piece at the Position, null if invalid

      • placePiece

        public AbstractPiece[][] placePiece(AbstractPiece p,
                                    boolean isDebug,
                                    AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Very brute function to place a piece in the game state and return the new game state. Does not take into consideration any restrictions or rules on movement, will literally place any piece anywhere on the board. Should be mostly used on empty boards, or if 100% sure that the tile in which the piece is about to placed is unoccupied. !!!BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN USING THIS!!!
        Parameters:
        p - piece to be place
        isDebug - is debug mode active
        gamestate - game state to edit
        Returns:
        game state with the piece placed

      • getTargetPiece

        public AbstractPiece getTargetPiece(AbstractPiece p,
                                    int x,
                                    int y,
                                    boolean isDebug,
                                    AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Returns a piece acquired from adding some some offset values x and y to the coordinates of the starting piece. Further used to check what piece (if any) is in the square another piece is about to go to.
        Parameters:
        p - the starting piece to check from
        x - the up and down movement
        y - the left and right movement
        isDebug - is debug mode active
        gamestate - current game state
        Returns:
        piece found at location, null if invalid

      • getTargetPiece

        public AbstractPiece getTargetPiece(Position pos,
                                    int x,
                                    int y,
                                    boolean isDebug,
                                    AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Returns a piece acquired from adding some some offset values x and y to the coordinates of the starting piece. Further used to check what piece (if any) is in the square another piece is about to go to.
        Parameters:
        pos - position of the starting piece
        x - the up and down movement
        y - the left and right movement
        isDebug - is debug mode active
        gamestate - current game state
        Returns:
        piece found at location, null if invalid

      • isOnBoard

        public boolean isOnBoard(int x,
                         int y)
        Checks if a specified coordinates are on the board
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if legal position, false if not

      • isOnBoard

        public boolean isOnBoard(Position pos)
        Checks if a specific Position object's position is on the board
        Parameters:
        pos - position to be checked
        Returns:
        true if legal position, false if not

      • placePiece

        public AbstractPiece[][] placePiece(AbstractPiece p,
                                    int x,
                                    int y,
                                    boolean isDebug,
                                    AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Very brute function to place a piece in the specified coordinates x and y of game state and return the new game state. Does not take into consideration any restrictions or rules on movement, will literally place any piece anywhere on the board. Should be mostly used on empty boards, or if 100% sure that the tile in which the piece is about to placed is unoccupied. !!!BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN USING THIS!!!
        Parameters:
        p - piece to be place
        x - x coordinate of the target tile
        y - y coordinate of the target tile
        isDebug - is debug mode active
        gamestate - game state to edit
        Returns:
        game state with the piece placed

      • placePiece

        public AbstractPiece[][] placePiece(AbstractPiece p,
                                    Position pos,
                                    boolean isDebug,
                                    AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Very brute function to place a piece in the specified position pos of the game state and return the new game state. Does not take into consideration any restrictions or rules on movement, will literally place any piece anywhere on the board. Should be mostly used on empty boards, or if 100% sure that the tile in which the piece is about to placed is unoccupied. !!!BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN USING THIS!!!
        Parameters:
        p - piece to be place
        pos - position of the target tile
        isDebug - is debug mode active
        gamestate - game state to edit
        Returns:
        game state with the piece placed

      • relocatePiece

        public AbstractPiece[][] relocatePiece(AbstractPiece p,
                                       AbstractPiece[][] gamestate,
                                       int xNew,
                                       int yNew)
        Very brute function to move a piece in the game state and return the new game state. Does not take into consideration any restrictions or rules on movement, will literally move any piece anywhere on the board. DOES NOT CHANGE THE COORDINATES IN THE PEACE OBJECT ITSELF! !!!BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN USING THIS!!!
        Parameters:
        p - piece to be moved
        gamestate - game state to be edited
        xNew - x coordinate of piece's new position
        yNew - y coordinate of piece's new position
        Returns:
        game state with the piece moved

      • relocatePiece

        public AbstractPiece[][] relocatePiece(AbstractPiece p,
                                       AbstractPiece[][] gamestate,
                                       Position newPos)
        Very brute function to move a piece in the game state and return the new game state. Does not take into consideration any restrictions or rules on movement, will literally move any piece anywhere on the board. !!!BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN USING THIS!!!
        Parameters:
        p - piece to be moved
        gamestate - game state to be edited
        newPos - new position for the piece
        Returns:
        game state with the piece moved
